content: Revenue in the TNM segment increased 35% In the third quarter to $6.9 million, making it the best quarter since last year's first quarter. Our strong third quarter booking came in at a $32.3 million rate, up 16% year-over-year, and up 6% sequentially from Q2. Looking at revenue by type, supplies and hardware revenue remained roughly flat with the third quarter of fiscal 2021, while service and other revenue was up 35% from the same period last year, the bulk of which was in T&A. Looking at operating -- segment operating margins this quarter product identification posted an operating margin of $1.8 million or 8.3% of revenue, compared with $3.5 million or 15.4% in the third quarter of fiscal '21, the decrease is primarily attributable to lower revenue and mix effects. Test and measurement segment operating margins in Q3 this year was $1 million or about 16.8%, representing a positive swing of about a 1.5 million from the third quarter of last year, which saw an operating loss of almost 700,000, or 14.7%. Year-to-date through Q3, GAAP segment operating profit for product identification was $8.9 million or 13.8%, excluding the  benefits that on a non-GAAP basis the segment operating margin was $7.5 million or 11%.
